Package pr1.helper.core

Class FileWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • pr1.helper.core.FileWriter
  • public class FileWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for creating and managing PrintWriter instances for file output.

    This class handles the creation of writable text files within a base directory specified by FileTarget. It also ensures that non-existing subdirectories are created automatically.

    Typical usage is through AbstractApplication, which provides higher-level lifecycle and error management for file output streams.

    Since:
    2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Benjamin Wagner
    See Also:
    FileTarget, PrintWriter, AbstractApplication

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileWriter

        public FileWriter​(FileTarget targetPath,
                  java.lang.String file)
        Constructs a FileWriter using a FileTarget as base directory and writes directly into the specified file.

        Example: if FileTarget.DATA_DIR resolves to ./data/ and file equals "output.txt", the resulting file will be ./data/output.txt.

        Parameters:
        targetPath - the base directory defined by FileTarget.
        file - the file name to be created within the base directory.
        See Also:
        FileTarget, PrintWriter

      • FileWriter

        public FileWriter​(FileTarget targetPath,
                  java.lang.String path,
                  java.lang.String file)
        Constructs a FileWriter using a FileTarget as base directory and an additional subdirectory path.

        If the subdirectory does not exist, it will be created automatically using File.mkdirs().

        Example: if FileTarget.DATA_DIR resolves to ./data/, path = "a02" and file = "result.txt", the resulting file will be ./data/a02/result.txt.

        Parameters:
        targetPath - the base directory defined by FileTarget.
        path - subdirectory path relative to targetPath.
        file - file name to be created within the subdirectory.
        See Also:
        FileTarget, File, PrintWriter

    • Method Detail

      • getWriter

        public java.io.PrintWriter getWriter()
        Returns the active PrintWriter instance.

        This writer can be used for direct write operations such as PrintWriter.print(String), PrintWriter.printf(String, Object...) or PrintWriter.append(CharSequence).

        Returns:
        the PrintWriter associated with this FileWriter.
        See Also:
        PrintWriter

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the underlying PrintWriter stream and releases all associated resources.

        After calling this method, further write operations will throw a IOException.

        See Also:
        PrintWriter.close()
